intro: Gymnocalycium horizonthalonium, commonly known as the desert rose cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of Central and South America. It is a low-growing, sprawling cactus with thick, fleshy stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces striking, funnel-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red, often appearing in the spring.
